originalText.text:
The first red flag was the place smelling heavily like acrylic when I entered. The second was the language barrier between me and my pedicure tech. Surprisingly, I was pleased with the regular polish pedicure. *It was the dip powder manicure that was the issue.*

I went in on a Friday afternoon. The nail tech seated in the 3rd chair serviced me. I asked her to shape my nails almond. *She did the dip first and shaped my nails after.* I've never had this order before so thought it strange. It resulted in being able to see the white of my nails when viewed from the side. I let this go because I liked that my nails felt seamless from the cuticle to the tip. *Two days later, the nails on my index fingers were lifting off.*

I went back that Mon to have my nails fixed. The same nail tech was seated in the 3rd chair and serviced me. First red flag: she tried to just add glue. Second red flag: when I told her that wouldn't work, she started peeling off the polish with the cuticle clipper. I asked her not to do this as she'd damage my nails. She said that wouldn't happen as she was just peeling off the loose parts.

She didn't take the nail fully off and only filled in the pieces she peeled off. I've never had this done and assumed this might be standard and similar to getting a filling, but in reverse. She did this for the four nails that were lifting and added glue to the others. She didn't charge me for this, which is good because I wouldn't have paid. Fast forward one week, the polish on both index fingers broke off when I was out at an event. The other fingers she glued also started to lift off.

My last dip powder mani at a different salon lasted 6 weeks and I could have kept it for longer if not for the nail growth. *A dip powder mani lasting 2-7 days in completely unacceptable.* Despite the staff being nice, I'm utterly disappointed. Perhaps their other services have better outcomes or their other nail techs are more skilled, but I will never return or recommend as they wasted both my money and time.

This business has two Google Maps entries. The one with a 4.5 rating is what got me there. As I was looking for a new place while in the shop I saw the 3.6 rating entry. I never would have come if I'd seen that one first. I'm posting this review on both entries.

originalText.text: I will not be coming back ! They are so unprofessional , They opened at 10 online I got here at 10:05 and no one is here then the girl comes and now 3 people are here and no one else is here and she’s literally calling the other mail people in front of the customers asking where they’re at one tells her she’s not coming in the other says idk I can’t give you a time I’m doing something and the last one said idk maybe 10 and then another girl that works here gets here and tells the 3 people waiting she can’t help them cause she has appointment. I watched 2 people sit there wait inside of my exit for my pedicure to be done and her appointment still wasn’t there. It was no leg calf massage lotion scrub it was very bare minimum ingrown nail removal and toes painted and done . Whole thing was 30 mins with little stops here and there to call her workers to come in. And my water is cold and I told her and she put a splash of hot water for a sec and turned it back off . Then to be charged $40 for something that could of been done at home for a simple toe paint
